casebody.data:
James Goodfellow, appellant, v. The Mayor, &c. of the City of New York, respondent. Decided February 4, 1884. Appeal from a judgment, dismissing the complaint with costs. B. F. Mudgett. for appellant; D. J. Dean, for respondent.

Before Truax and O’Gorman, JJ.

Per Curiam.

The evidence failed to show any negligence in the defendant and therefore the complaint was rightly dismissed. The judgment is affirmed, with costs.
